name: The Fool
description: The Fool is usually depicted as a beggar or a vagabond, he wears ragged clothes & stockings without shoes, and carries a stick on his back.
interpretation: The Fool represents new beginnings, having faith in the future, being inexperienced, not knowing what to expect, having beginner's luck, improvisation and believing in the universe.

name: The Magician
message: May you never miss your goal
description: The image of the Magician shows a man who is standing in front of his powerful altar with tools that represent all four directions and the four suits in the tarot.
interpretation: When the Magician appears in a spread, it points to the talents, capabilities and resources at the querent's disposal to succeed. The message is to tap into one's full potential rather than holding back, especially when there is a need to transform something.

name: The High Priestess
description: The High Priestess is identified with the Shekhinah, the female indwelling presence of the divine. She wears plain blue robes and sits with her hands in her lap. She has a lunar crescent at her feet, & wears "a horned diadem on her head, with a globe in the middle".
interpretation: The High Priestess is a card of mystery, stillness and passivity. This card suggests that it is time to retreat and reflect upon the situation and trust your inner instincts to guide you through it. Things around you are not what they appear to be right now.

name: The Empress
description: The Empress sits on a throne wearing a starry crown, holding a scepter in one hand. The scepter is representative of her power over life, her crown has twelve stars representing her dominance over the year, and her throne is in the midst of a field of grain, representative of her dominion over growing things.
interpretation: The Empress is traditionally associated with maternal influence, it is the card if you are hoping to start a family. She can represent the creation of life, romance, art, or new business.

name: The Emperor
description: The Emperor sits on a ram-adorned throne, a symbol of Mars. He holds an ankh scepter in his right hand, and a globe, symbol of domination, in his left. The Emperor sits atop a stark, barren mountain, a sign of "sterility of regulation, and unyielding power".
interpretation: This card is suggestive of stability and security in life. You are on top of things and everything in under your control. It is your hard work, discipline and self control that have bought you this far. It means that you are in charge of your life now setting up your own rules and boundaries.

name: The Hierophant
description: The Hierophant is seen seated on a throne between two pillars symbolizing law and liberty or obedience and disobedience. He wears a triple crown, and the keys to Heaven are at his feet.
interpretation: The Hierophant stands for tradition and convention. It can represent marriage in an arranged setup. It can also mean a teacher or counsellor who will help in learning / education of the querent.

name: The Lovers
message: May you prosper and be in good health
description: A man and woman stand in possibly the Garden of Eden, with "The Tree of Life" behind the man and "The Tree of Knowledge" behind the woman.
interpretation: The Lovers represent relationships and choices. Its appearance in a spread indicates some decision about an existing relationship, a temptation of the heart, or a choice of potential partners. Often an aspect of the querent's life will have to be sacrificed; a bachelor(ette)'s lifestyle may be sacrificed and a relationship gained (or vice versa), or one potential partner may be chosen while another is turned down. Whatever the choice, it should not be made lightly, as the ramifications will be lasting.

name: The Chariot
description: A powerful, princely figure sits in a swift chariot, pulled usually by two sphinxes or horses. The figure is crowned and holds a sword or wand.
interpretation: The Chariot is a card about overcoming conflicts and moving forward in a positive direction. One needs to keep going on and through sheer hard work and commitment he will be victorious.

name: Justice
description: The figure in the Justice card holds two objects: a scale in one hand as a symbol of balance and a sword in the other to exemplify the preservation of that equilibrium even by means of force.
interpretation: The Justice card indicates that the fairest decision will be made. Justice is the sword that cuts through a situation, and will not be swayed by outer beauty when deciding what is fair and just.

name: The Hermit
message: May you see what life has to offer
description: An old man carrying a staff in one hand and a lit lantern containing a six-pointed star in the other hand.
interpretation: The Hermit suggests that you are in a phase of introspection where you are drawing your attention inwards and looking for answers within. You are in need of a period of inner reflection, away from the current demands of your position.

name: Wheel of Fortune
description: In this card, we see a revolving wheel which represents the wheel of life. In each corner of the card we see four winged creatures sitting upon clouds. These creatures represent the four elements of minor arcana.
interpretation: A common aspect to most interpretations of this card within a reading is to introduce an element of change in the querent's life, such change being in station, position or fortune: such as the rich becoming poor, or the poor becoming rich.

name: Strength
description: A woman and a lion, with the woman looking calm and gentle, yet dominant over the lion.
interpretation: Strength predicts the triumphant conclusion to a major life problem, situation or temptation through strength of character. It is a very happy card if you are fighting illness or recovering from injury.

name: The Hanged Man
description: It depicts a pittura infamante, a shameful image of a traitor being punished in a manner common at the time for traitors in Italy. Some versions portray Judas, and include the bags of silver in his hands.
interpretation: The Hanged Man is the card that suggests ultimate surrender, sacrifice, or being suspended in time.

name: Death
message: Lay waste to all that oppose you
description: The Death card usually depicts a skeleton, sometimes riding a horse but more often wielding a sickle. Surrounding it are dead and dying people from all classes, including kings, bishops and commoners.
interpretation: Unlikely that this card actually represents a physical death. Typically it implies an end, possibly of a relationship or interest, and therefore implies an increased sense of self-awareness.

name: Temperance
message: May you be pure in heart
description: Temperance is almost invariably depicted as a person pouring liquid from one receptacle into another. In many decks, the person is a winged person/angel, usually female or androgynous, and stands with one foot on water and one foot on land.
interpretation: This card indicates that you should learn to bring about balance, patience and moderation in your life. You should take the middle road, avoiding extremes and maintain a sense of calm.

name: The Devil
message: Revel in the power of darkness
description: The Devil card depicts the devil as the ancient goat-god Dionysius, shown sitting in his throne while watching over a male and female captive.
interpretation: The Devil represents being seduced by the material world and physical pleasures. Also living in fear, domination and bondage, being caged by an overabundance of luxury, discretion should be used in personal and business matters.

name: The Tower
description: The image of the Tower card is powerful, depicting a solid tower being struck by lightning, and fire crawling out from the small windows at its top.
interpretation: The Tower is commonly interpreted as meaning danger, crisis, destruction, and liberation. It is associated with sudden unforseen change, which are inevitably forced upon you by external circumstances.

name: The Star
message: May you find what you desire
description: A naked woman kneels by the water with one foot in the water, and other on the land. Above her head a star shines out. In each hand she holds a jug, from one jug she pours a liquid into the water and from the other jug she pours a liquid onto the land.
interpretation: When the Star card appears, you are likely to find yourself feeling inspired. It brings renewed hope and faith and a sense that you are truly blessed by the universe at this time.

name: The Moon
message: May you find all you have lost
description: A full moon (with a crescent within), twin pillars, two dogs/wolves howling, a stream that runs to the ocean, a crayfish emerging out of the water.
interpretation: The Moon is a card of illusion and deception, and therefore often suggests a time when something is not as it appears to be. Perhaps a misunderstanding on your part, or a truth you cannot admit to yourself.

name: The Sun
message: May the light heal and enlighten you
description: An infant rides a white horse under the anthropomorphized sun, with sunflowers in the background.
interpretation: The Sun portends good fortune, happiness, joy and harmony. It represents the universe coming together and agreeing with your path and aiding forward movement into something greater.

name: Judgement
description: An angel, possibly Gabriel, is depicted blowing a great trumpet, from which hangs a white flag bearing a red cross. A group of humans of grayish complexion stand, arms spread, are apparently emerging from graves.
interpretation: This card is referred to as a time of resurrection and awakening, a time when a period of our life comes to an absolute end making way for dynamic new beginnings.

name: The World
description: A naked woman hovers or dances above the earth holding a staff in each hand, surrounded by a green wreath, being watched by various creatures.
interpretation: The World represents an ending to a cycle of life, a pause in life before the next big cycle beginning with the fool. It is an indicator of a major and inexorable change, of tectonic breadth.

name: The Fool Reversed
description: The Fool is usually depicted as a beggar or a vagabond, he wears ragged clothes & stockings without shoes, and carries a stick on his back.
interpretation: The Fool Reversed represents chaos, lack of direction, being folly or naive and acting overly risky, reckless or out of uncertainty.

name: The Magician Reversed
message: May no harm come to you
description: The image of the Magician shows a man who is standing in front of his powerful altar with tools that represent all four directions and the four suits in the tarot.
interpretation: When the Magician Reversed appears in a spread, it points to the exploring of not yet manifested goals. It might feel like no progress or success towards these goals is made, for which the reason can be a misalignement between the end goal, the original reason and the higher good. Stay attuned to your intuition and pay attention to opportunities as they arise.

name: The High Priestess Reversed
description: The High Priestess is identified with the Shekhinah, the female indwelling presence of the divine. She wears plain blue robes and sits with her hands in her lap. She has a lunar crescent at her feet, & wears "a horned diadem on her head, with a globe in the middle".
interpretation: The High Priestess Reversed calls on you to be still and listen to your inner voice and wisdom. It signals that it is time to withdraw yourself from the external world, other people's opinions and their drama and look inwards for guidance. If you are hiding your intuitive capabilities from others, know that your intuition is your strength that you should embrace.

name: The Empress Reversed
description: The Empress sits on a throne wearing a starry crown, holding a scepter in one hand. The scepter is representative of her power over life, her crown has twelve stars representing her dominance over the year, and her throne is in the midst of a field of grain, representative of her dominion over growing things.
interpretation: The Empress Reversed signals a lack of self-care, identified by putting too much emphasis on others opinions and their needs to your own detriment. You might also feel less confident, unattractive or undesirable. The Empress encourages embracing your feminine qualities, embracing nature around you, focusing on your own needs and correcting personal imbalances. This card could also hint towards an imbalanced parent child relationship.

name: The Emperor Reversed
message: May you find a worthy opponent
description: The Emperor sits on a ram-adorned throne, a symbol of Mars. He holds an ankh scepter in his right hand, and a globe, symbol of domination, in his left. The Emperor sits atop a stark, barren mountain, a sign of "sterility of regulation, and unyielding power".
interpretation: This card calls on you to assess your relationship with power, control, authority, responsibility and discipline. Power imbalances might be enforced by you or people who surround you. Are you asserting power and dominance on others or are you unwilling to step up to responsibilities as a leader. A correlation to problems regarding a father figure in your childhood can be implied. Power can be equally and constructively distributed, you don't need to take from others or give yours away.

name: The Hierophant Reversed
description: The Hierophant is seen seated on a throne between two pillars symbolizing law and liberty or obedience and disobedience. He wears a triple crown, and the keys to Heaven are at his feet.
interpretation: The Hierophant Reversed encourages you to follow your own path and adopt your own spiritual belief system rather than being a blind follower even if it goes against tradition or convention. Challenge the status quo as you are ready to reject rigid structures and dogma that surround you and rebel and reclaim your own personal power. By questioning society and not following the crowd there may be a run-ins or conflicts with authoritative figures.

name: The Lovers Reversed
message: May your heart shatter to pieces
description: A man and woman stand in possibly the Garden of Eden, with "The Tree of Life" behind the man and "The Tree of Knowledge" behind the woman.
interpretation: The Lovers Reversed represent disharmony with yourself or in a relationships, or tough choices with significant consequences, for which you might be tempted to cut corners and avoid responsibilities instead of deciding based on your morals. This card can also reflect non-mutual feelings within a relationship, which could lead to disappointment and insecurity down the line. It also encourages self-respect, even if it means that it could be time to let go, and resolving inner conflicts.

name: The Chariot Reversed
description: A powerful, princely figure sits in a swift chariot, pulled usually by two sphinxes or horses. The figure is crowned and holds a sword or wand.
interpretation: The Chariot Reversed calls for taking a step back, reassessing the situation or remember the reasons why you wanted to achieve your goals in the first place. This card indicates difficulties in achieving your goals that can be overcome by being discliplined and tightening the reins, or they might stem from a deeper problem that discourages you from achieving your goals.

name: Justice Reversed
message: May your sins come back to torment you
description: The figure in the Justice card holds two objects: a scale in one hand as a symbol of balance and a sword in the other to exemplify the preservation of that equilibrium even by means of force.
interpretation: The Justice Reversed card indicates you might have done something that isn't morally right. You have the choice to stand up to your mistakes but you seem to not be willing to take full accountability for your actions and want to blame others for your mistakes. It seems that you either enforce unbalanced decision on others or yourself suffer from one made by someone else.

name: The Hermit Reversed
message: May you see the value of all things in life
description: An old man carrying a staff in one hand and a lit lantern containing a six-pointed star in the other hand.
interpretation: The Hermit Reversed suggests that you are taking not enough time for personal reflection or too much. You are either so busy with day-to-day issues that you've forgotten to listen to your inner voice or you are isolating yourself too much while pursuing your phase of introspection. If the latter applies you should not underestimate your connections to family and friends and refrain from shutting them out.

name: Wheel of Fortune Reversed
description: In this card, we see a revolving wheel which represents the wheel of life. In each corner of the card we see four winged creatures sitting upon clouds. These creatures represent the four elements of minor arcana.
interpretation: The Wheel of Fortune Reversed indicates luck and fortune taking a turn for the worse, leading to unexpected changes with negative outcomes. Another common interpretation is that this card reflects a resistance to change, especially if its forced upon the querent. In this case you might need to accept the change as it is inevitable and could be more positive than you think. This card could also indicate the breaking of a cycle, although it might be necessary to hit rock bottom first to realize the necessity of change, especially if The Devil or The Tower was also drawn.

name: Strength Reversed
description: A woman and a lion, with the woman looking calm and gentle, yet dominant over the lion.
interpretation: Strength Reversed indicates an imbalance in inner strength, confidence and self-belief, no matter if the imbalance stems from an abundance or a lack of them. You might want to take care of your energy if you feel sluggish, so you can take core of others afterwards. This card can also signal explosive or aggressive behaviour, acting without thinking and the following regret.

name: The Hanged Man Reversed
message: May your greed know no bounds
description: It depicts a pittura infamante, a shameful image of a traitor being punished in a manner common at the time for traitors in Italy. Some versions portray Judas, and include the bags of silver in his hands.
interpretation: The Hanged Man Reversed is the card that warns you from ending up crashing if you go down your current path further or rushing things, asking you to stop resisting taking a pause. You may already be in a position where everything has been put on hold, much to your frustration and dismay, in which case you have to accept this fate instead of being attached to what should be. You might also be stalling a decision or action until you feel fully ready, although this will never be the case.

name: Death Reversed
message: May life spring forth from the fallen
description: The Death card usually depicts a skeleton, sometimes riding a horse but more often wielding a sickle. Surrounding it are dead and dying people from all classes, including kings, bishops and commoners.
interpretation: The Death Reversed indicates being on the verge of meaningful change but resisting it or being reluctant to let go, which leads to stagnation. It can hint on a massive personal transformation, not visible to others, that you can want to keep for yourself until it is done. Examine other drawn cards close or draw a follow up card to understand better what should be let go or what new should be embraced.

name: Temperance Reversed
description: Temperance is almost invariably depicted as a person pouring liquid from one receptacle into another. In many decks, the person is a winged person/angel, usually female or androgynous, and stands with one foot on water and one foot on land.
interpretation: This card warns you that you should bring balance and moderation into your life as soon as possible and stop living in excess. Temperance Reserved can also be a sign of something being "off" in your life, creating stress and tension, which you can ignore but best should resolve as early as possible.

name: The Devil Reversed
message: Bask in the light of your mercy
description: The Devil card depicts the devil as the ancient goat-god Dionysius, shown sitting in his throne while watching over a male and female captive.
interpretation: The Devil Reversed represents letting go of any unhealthy attachments before being called to your highest potential or something greater. The Devil Reversed calls on you to confront your inner fears and anxieties to free yourself from the chains that bind you to your limiting beliefs and attachments. It can also appear when you are going into your deepest, darkest places, ready or not, to understand your innermost shadows, so you can release them or integrate them into your life in a constructive way. You might also be hiding your deepest, darkest self from others out of embarrassment or shame. This card encourages releasing your dependencies on things, people or concepts of the world.

name: The Tower Reversed
description: The image of the Tower card is powerful, depicting a solid tower being struck by lightning, and fire crawling out from the small windows at its top.
interpretation: The Tower Reversed stands for self instigated change, personal transformation and calling into question fundamental belief systems, values, purpose, and meaning, which may lead to a temporary existential crisis. You may resist change and delay necessary destruction and upheaval, maybe clinging to an old belief system although it being irrelevant or unhealthy. The mentioned changes are inevitable but the reversal of The Tower can reduce their impact if you are in tune with your intuition.

name: The Star Reversed
description: A naked woman kneels by the water with one foot in the water, and other on the land. Above her head a star shines out. In each hand she holds a jug, from one jug she pours a liquid into the water and from the other jug she pours a liquid onto the land.
interpretation: When the Star Reversed card appears, you are likely to find yourself feeling overwhelmed by life's challenges and having lost faith and hope. This however is a test of faith through being confronted with challenging situations, in which you can crumble or stand firm.

name: The Moon Reversed
description: A full moon (with a crescent within), twin pillars, two dogs/wolves howling, a stream that runs to the ocean, a crayfish emerging out of the water.
interpretation: The Moon Reversed is a card that signals the subsiding of illusion, fear and anxiety, and therefore often suggests a liberating and transformational experience as these limiting beliefs are left behind. You may also just want to bury these feelings and beliefs, because you are not ready to face them, which might work in the short-term, but them must inevitably eventually resurface. You might also subconsciously receive messages which you struggle to understand and interpret. The Moon Reversed calls to listen to your inner voice instead of others, pay attention to your dreams or come back later with more clarity.

name: The Sun Reversed
message: May the darkness swallow all around you
description: An infant rides a white horse under the anthropomorphized sun, with sunflowers in the background.
interpretation: The Sun Reversed encourages you to leave your work and reponsibilities behind to be carefree even for just one moment. You may be discouraged, depressed or pessimistic and struggle to see the bright side of life, while your path appears clouded or distorted. Yet this is only temporary as the sun is never a negative card, which means the obstacles although seeming difficult can be easily removed. The Sun Reversed might also intend to show you that you are being too confident or overly optimistic despite the circumstance, which could make you become egotistical or out of touch.

name: Judgement Reversed
message: May you redeem those found wanting
description: An angel, possibly Gabriel, is depicted blowing a great trumpet, from which hangs a white flag bearing a red cross. A group of humans of grayish complexion stand, arms spread, are apparently emerging from graves.
interpretation: This card intends to warn you to not hold back from making necessary decisions and suggests to learn lessons from mistakes in the past instead of dwelling in them. The Judgement Reversed might also point to others or the querent being overly judgemental of each other instead of themselves. In regards to legal matters this card indicates an unjust or unfair judgement being made.

name: The World Reversed
description: A naked woman hovers or dances above the earth holding a staff in each hand, surrounded by a green wreath, being watched by various creatures.
interpretation: The World Reversed suggests that you are seeking closure, for which you need to let go of the past to accept where you are now. You might also want to fulfil a big goal, but are not taking all necessary steps or taking shortcuts, although the trials and tribulations along the way are what makes you learn and grow, and makes the success more rewarding. The World Reversed can also indicate a time of being close to finishing a project or goal but getting discouraged or having to deal with frustrating delays.
